issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Example usage is not correct in Transparent Encryption document

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I found "hadoop key" command usage is not documented when reviewing HDFS-9784.
In addition, we should document that uppercase is not allowed for key name.
fields.summary: "hadoop key" command usage is not documented

comments.body: Thanks [~ajisakaa] for filing this. I'd like to work on this one, and gain more knowledge.

Attached patch 1 to add documentation. The usage part is copied from the command usage directly (found a typo there, corrected), adapting to the markdown format. Also attached a generated html for easier reviewing.

The reason that HDFS-9784 saw the exception is due to [a KeyProvider's precondition check|https://github.com/apache/hadoop/blob/trunk/hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/crypto/key/JavaKeyStoreProvider.java#L433].

Please see if the document makes sense. Thank you!
